DOC.TEXT: Prices were little changed in light trading on Wall Street today as the stock market shrugged off declines in Treasury bonds. The Dow Jones average of 30 industrials was up 0.43 at 2,711.82 as of noon EST after have been down about seven points in earlier trading. Advancing and declining issues were about even, with 580 stocks rising, 600 declining and 564 unchanged on the New York Stock Exchange. Volume on the Big Board came to a light 35.37 million shares at midday, following the three-day Christmas holiday weekend. Stocks declined early in the session as bond prices slumped in response to an increase Monday in Japan's discount rate from 3.75 percent to 4.25 percent. The Treasury's 30-year bond was down about | point, or $6.25 per $1,000 in face amount, while its yield rose to 7.93 from 7.88 late Friday. Analysts said some of the drop in bonds also was attributable to concerns about rising inflation. Prices for heating oil and orange juice futures rose sharply today because of the cold weather, and traders speculated that inflation might accelerate. But as the session progressed on Wall Street, many traders decided that there was little cause for concern, said Michael Metz, an analyst with Oppenheimer & Co. Metz said many investors had available cash, and were in the market picking up bargains. The most-actively traded stock on the NYSE was Bank of New England, which rose } to 8\. Exxon was down ] to 50\ after a weekend explosion shut down a major refinery in Texas. AT&T was up \ to 45, IBM was off ] to 95 and Sears, Roebuck was up \ to 37. The NYSE's composite index of all its listed common stocks rose 0.02 to 191.97. On the American Stock Exchange, the market value index fell 0.44 to 370.40.
